medical_history.chief_complaint: Loss of consciousness triggered by visual stimuli.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced episodes characterized by initial dizziness and paleness, followed by sudden loss of consciousness, which started a year prior to the visit. There were five episodes during video game playing or watching TV, lasting approximately 2 minutes, with full recovery within 1 to 2 minutes. Before these episodes, the patient had brief visual disturbances in front of the TV.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital rectal prolapse, colonic diverticulosis, and iron deficiency anemia.
medical_history.family_history: Father died from ruptures of cerebral aneurysms at age 46; paternal grandfather died from same cause at age 72. The patient has two healthy sisters.
medical_history.social_history: Regular cannabis use starting at age 13. No drugs or alcohol reported.
